Wow... I was waiting for Jenkins/Travis before Ring you guys ðŸ˜„ 
This should solve the Jenkins issues since all `spark.*` System properties propagate into the `SparkConf`

LGTM once tests pass. The conservative software engineer in me says that we should stick to public documented properties and use `spark.ui.port=0` but I can suppress that feeling since this property _should_ be public.
PTAL. Also moved the //////// that separates private and public ;)
Done. PTAL.

Thanks, merged!

Don't know of anything meaningful that hasn't been mentioned. From my perspective though, since Jenkins is where the bulk of our testing effort is, it would be good to keep what we can there. If you think the pros outweigh that though, feel free to push back.

So, I haven't looked beyond the CombineTest note, but you're definitely right. The trigger in `testGlobalCombineDefaultsWithTriggers` should be `Repeatedly.forever(AfterPane.elementCountAtLeast(1))`, and the `testHotKeyCombiningWithAccumulationMode` should have a more forgiving assertion.

https://github.com/aljoscha/incubator-beam/pull/1
Will wait for tests to turn green and then I'd like to submit. @kennknowles any comments?

```
[WARNING] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/DoFnReflectorTest.java:[415,70] static method should be qualified by type name, org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.dofnreflector.DoFnReflectorTestHelper, instead of by an expression
```
R: @dhalperi
LGTM when green.
LGTM
LGTM when green (see warning become error mentioned above).
This looks great. It could help many users. Merging.

LGTM.

I'm merging.
R: @tgroh

Agree to remove the KEYS from the distro. However, instead of using the "global" KEYS file, I would prefer to have a Beam KEYS file. 
It's what we are doing in most of other Apache projects:
- http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/karaf/KEYS
- http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/servicemix/KEYS
- https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/master/KEYS

So, what do you think about excluding KEYS from the distro but keeping KEYS on our git ?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6056818/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6056818)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6057523/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6057523)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

Since keys is required on the distro site, I am concerned that we have the same info in two places -- they will get out of sync. Since the distro is required, I'd prefer to drop the keys file here.

I also looked at 3 of the biggest Apache projects, and they do not have a `KEYS` file:
- [Maven](https://github.com/apache/maven)
- [Hadoop](https://github.com/apache/hadoop)
- [Avro](https://github.com/apache/avro)
So I'd like to drop our `KEYS` -- okay with you?
LGTM

R: @dhalperi, @amitsela, @mxm 
PTAL

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6063043/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6063043)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
By the way, Maven has its own KEYS file: https://maven.apache.org/developers/release/pmc-gpg-keys.html
https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/maven/project/KEYS
No longer relevant
Closing in favor of https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/739
Same for Hadoop: https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/hadoop/common/KEYS

As our KEYS file is already on dist.apache.orgI can move the KEYS on dist.apache.org, it makes sense to remove from the git.

LGTM, I'm merging.

OK, I moved the `streaming-runnable-on-service-tests` execution to the profile as well.

@mxm you are completely correct about the different tests. Those that are activated by a property are run by Jenkins using a local configuration. That could change to a cluster in the future.

I agree that we should test the most common use case. I don't have much more to say than that as far as how and where it might be provisioned in the future. Maybe it is a good discussion for the dev list?

According to http://www.apache.org/dev/licensing-howto.html#alv2-dep Apache license is not required in the NOTICE. However, the copyright is required.

I'm merging.

LGTM. I'll publish in dev list tomorrow.

I think this is a good time to get rid of `SparkStreamingPipelineOptions` as it became a "timeout-container" only..
The rest of course is running pipelines with `Pipeline.run()`.
R: @dhalperi - it was a little bit more than a couple of streaming examples ðŸ˜‰
Merged!

One thing is that I think you might do while changing this is to replace `repackaged` with something that more clearly indicates DO NOT USE THIS, like... `do.not.use` or `private` or `internal`.

Something that is extremely easy to grep would be cool too. I just looked up the lexical rules and it seems you could throw some underscores in there for good measure, like `do_not_use`.
+R: @lukecwik. Can you take a look? Thanks.

Jenkins has been happy all along. Do you have any comments about the code itself? I'll keep prodding the infrastructure to see if it passes or uncovers a real issue.

Hi, Sorry to intrusion. 
I was curious and decided to build this out of curiosity

```
/Users/sergioisidoro/Development/sandboxes/beam/lib/python2.7/site-packages/google_apitools-0.5.4-py2.7.egg/apitools/base/protorpclite/messages.py in __init__(cls, name, bases, dct)
    301     def __init__(cls, name, bases, dct):
    302         # Can only define one level of sub-classes below Enum.
--> 303         if not (bases == (object,) or bases == (Enum,)):
    304             raise EnumDefinitionError(
    305                 'Enum type %s may only inherit from Enum' % name)

NameError: global name 'Enum' is not defined
```

Further check and it appears that the problem might be this:

https://github.com/google/apitools/issues/123
https://github.com/google/apitools/blob/master/apitools/base/protorpclite/messages.py#L303

I'm actually wondering if there's even any need for the CompressionType class. Maybe it should just be an enum? Either that or CompressionTypes should be unified with CompressionType with the static methods becoming instance methods.
LGTM. Thank you.

Hi @sergioisidoro I am confused about your comment, could you please explain it a bit more? The problem we are experiencing now is Maven related. We are having trouble getting the `exec` rule running without inheriting from the parents. And we have not seen the error you mentioned: `global name 'Enum' is not defined`.

@wikier I can reproduce this locally by:

```
cd sdks/python
mvn clean install
```

I got the same error as Jenkins. I have Maven 3.0.5 installed. Do you not get any error when you run the above locally? Maybe it is related to the Maven version.

It does not happen in Travis, because it does not use Maven to build.
Close at your leisure.
Thanks.
